001
002package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.node;
003
004import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.StaticContext;
005import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.format.IPathFormatter;
006import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.format.IPathSegment;
007import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItem;
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItemVisitor;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.IResourceLocation;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
011
012import java.net.URI;
013import java.util.Collection;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.stream.Stream;
016
017import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
018
019import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
020import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
021
022/**
023 * Represents a queryable Metapath model node.
024 */
025public interface INodeItem extends IItem, IPathSegment, INodeItemVisitable {
026  /**
027   * Retrieve the relative position of this node relative to sibling nodes.
028   * <p>
029   * A singleton item in a sequence will have a position value of {@code 1}.
030   * <p>
031   * The value {@code 1} is used as the starting value to align with the XPath
032   * specification.
033   *
034   * @return a positive integer value designating this instance's position within
035   *         a collection
036   */
037  default int getPosition() {
038    // only model node items have positions other than 1
039    return 1;
040  }
041
042  /**
043   * Generate a path for this node in the directed node graph, using the provided
044   * path formatter.
045   */
046  @Override
047  String format(IPathFormatter formatter);
048
049  /**
050   * Gets the value of the provided node item.
051   * <p>
052   * If the provided node item is a document, this method get the first child node
053   * item's value, since a document doesn't have a value.
054   *
055   * @param <CLASS>
056   *          the type of the bound object to return
057   * @param item
058   *          the node item to get the value of
059   * @return a bound object
060   * @throws NullPointerException
061   *           if the node item has no associated value
062   */
063  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
064  @NonNull
065  static <CLASS> CLASS toValue(@NonNull INodeItem item) {
066    INodeItem valuedItem;
067    if (item instanceof IDocumentNodeItem) {
068      // get first child item, since the document has no value
069      valuedItem = item.modelItems().findFirst().get();
070    } else {
071      valuedItem = item;
072    }
073    return ObjectUtils.requireNonNull((CLASS) valuedItem.getValue());
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * Retrieve the parent node item if it exists.
078   *
079   * @return the parent node item, or {@code null} if this node item has no known
080   *         parent
081   */
082  INodeItem getParentNodeItem();
083
084  /**
085   * Retrieve the parent content node item if it exists. A content node is a
086   * non-document node.
087   *
088   * @return the parent content node item, or {@code null} if this node item has
089   *         no known parent content node item
090   */
091  IModelNodeItem<?, ?> getParentContentNodeItem();
092
093  /**
094   * Get the type of node item this is.
095   *
096   * @return the node item's type
097   */
098  @NonNull
099  NodeItemType getNodeItemType();
100
101  /**
102   * Retrieve the base URI of this node.
103   * <p>
104   * The base URI of a node will be in order of preference:
105   * <ol>
106   * <li>the base URI defined on the node</li>
107   * <li>the base URI defined on the nearest ancestor node</li>
108   * <li>the base URI defined on the document node</li>
109   * <li>{@code null} if the document node is unknown</li>
110   * </ol>
111   *
112   * @return the base URI or {@code null} if it is unknown
113   */
114  URI getBaseUri();
115
116  /**
117   * Get the path for this node item as a Metapath.
118   *
119   * @return the Metapath
120   */
121  @NonNull
122  default String getMetapath() {
123    return toPath(IPathFormatter.METAPATH_PATH_FORMATER);
124  }
125
126  @Override
127  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> getPathStream() {
128    INodeItem parent = getParentNodeItem();
129    return ObjectUtils.notNull(
130        parent == null ? Stream.of(this) : Stream.concat(getParentNodeItem().getPathStream(), Stream.of(this)));
131  }
132
133  /**
134   * Get a stream of all ancestors of this node item. The stream is ordered from
135   * closest to farthest ancestor.
136   *
137   * @return a stream of ancestor node items
138   */
139  @NonNull
140  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> ancestor() {
141    return ancestorsOf(this);
142  }
143
144  /**
145   * Get a stream of this and all ancestors of this node item. The stream is
146   * ordered from self, then closest to farthest ancestor.
147   *
148   * @return a stream of this node followed by all ancestor node items
149   */
150  @NonNull
151  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> ancestorOrSelf() {
152    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.concat(Stream.of(this), ancestor()));
153  }
154
155  /**
156   * Get a stream of the ancestors of the provided {@code item}. The stream is
157   * ordered from the closest to farthest ancestor.
158   *
159   * @param item
160   *          the target item to get ancestors for
161   *
162   * @return a stream of all ancestor node items
163   */
164  @NonNull
165  static Stream<? extends INodeItem> ancestorsOf(@NonNull INodeItem item) {
166    INodeItem parent = item.getParentNodeItem();
167    return ObjectUtils.notNull(parent == null ? Stream.empty() : Stream.concat(Stream.of(parent), ancestorsOf(parent)));
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Get a stream of all descendant model items of this node item. The stream is
172   * ordered from closest to farthest descendants in a depth-first order.
173   *
174   * @return a stream of descendant node items
175   */
176  @NonNull
177  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> descendant() {
178    return decendantsOf(this);
179  }
180
181  /**
182   * Get a stream of all descendant model items of the provided {@code item}. The
183   * stream is ordered from closest to farthest descendants in a depth-first
184   * order.
185   *
186   * @param item
187   *          the target item to get descendants for
188   *
189   * @return a stream of descendant node items
190   */
191  @NonNull
192  static Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> decendantsOf(@NonNull INodeItem item) {
193    Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> children = item.modelItems();
194
195    return ObjectUtils.notNull(children.flatMap(child -> {
196      assert child != null;
197      return Stream.concat(Stream.of(child), decendantsOf(child));
198    }));
199  }
200
201  /**
202   * Get a stream of this node, followed by all descendant model items of this
203   * node item. The stream is ordered from closest to farthest descendants in a
204   * depth-first order.
205   *
206   * @return a stream of this node and descendant node items
207   */
208  @NonNull
209  default Stream<? extends INodeItem> descendantOrSelf() {
210    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.concat(Stream.of(this), descendant()));
211  }
212
213  /**
214   * Get the children of this node's parent that occur after this node in a
215   * depth-first order.
216   *
217   * @return a stream of nodes
218   */
219  @NonNull
220  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> followingSibling() {
221    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.empty());
222  }
223
224  /**
225   * Get the children of this node's parent, and their descendants, that occur
226   * before this node in a depth-first order.
227   *
228   * @return a stream of nodes
229   */
230  @NonNull
231  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> precedingSibling() {
232    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.empty());
233  }
234
235  /**
236   * Get the children of this node's parent, and their descendants, that occur
237   * before this node in a depth-first order.
238   *
239   * @return a stream of nodes
240   */
241  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> following() {
242    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.empty());
243  }
244
245  /**
246   * Get the children of this node's parent, and their descendants, that occur
247   * after this node in a depth-first order.
248   *
249   * @return a stream of nodes
250   */
251  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> preceding() {
252    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.empty());
253  }
254
255  /**
256   * Get the flags and value data associated this node. The resulting collection
257   * is expected to be ordered, with the results in document order.
258   * <p>
259   * The resulting collection may be modified, but such modification is not thread
260   * safe
261   *
262   * @return a collection of flags
263   */
264  @NonNull
265  Collection<? extends IFlagNodeItem> getFlags();
266
267  /**
268   * Lookup a flag and value data on this node by it's effective qualified name.
269   *
270   * @param name
271   *          the effective name of the flag
272   * @return the flag with the matching effective name or {@code null} if no match
273   *         was found
274   */
275  @Nullable
276  IFlagNodeItem getFlagByName(@NonNull QName name);
277
278  /**
279   * Get the flags and value data associated with this node as a stream.
280   *
281   * @return the stream of flags or an empty stream if none exist
282   */
283  @SuppressWarnings("null")
284  @NonNull
285  default Stream<? extends IFlagNodeItem> flags() {
286    return getFlags().stream();
287  }
288
289  /**
290   * Get the model items (i.e., fields, assemblies) and value data associated this
291   * node. A given model instance can be multi-valued, so the value of each
292   * instance will be a list. The resulting collection is expected to be ordered,
293   * with the results in document order.
294   * <p>
295   * The resulting collection may be modified, but such modification is not thread
296   * safe
297   *
298   * @return a collection of list(s), with each list containing the items for a
299   *         given model instance
300   */
301  @NonNull
302  Collection<? extends List<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>>> getModelItems();
303
304  /**
305   * Get the collection of model items associated with the instance having the
306   * provided {@code name}.
307   * <p>
308   * The resulting collection may be modified, but such modification is not thread
309   * safe
310   *
311   * @param name
312   *          the instance name to get model items for
313   * @return the sequence of items associated with the named model instance, or an
314   *         empty list if an instance with that name is not present
315   */
316  @NonNull
317  List<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> getModelItemsByName(@NonNull QName name);
318
319  /**
320   * Get the model items (i.e., fields, assemblies) and value data associated this
321   * node as a stream.
322   *
323   * @return the stream of model items or an empty stream if none exist
324   */
325  @SuppressWarnings("null")
326  @NonNull
327  default Stream<? extends IModelNodeItem<?, ?>> modelItems() {
328    return getModelItems().stream().flatMap(Collection::stream);
329  }
330
331  /**
332   * Get the resource location information for the node, if known.
333   *
334   * @return the resource location information, or {@code null} if not known
335   */
336  @Nullable
337  IResourceLocation getLocation();
338
339  /**
340   * Get the string value of the node.
341   *
342   * @return the string value of the node or an empty string if it has no value.
343   */
344  @NonNull
345  String stringValue();
346
347  /**
348   * Get the static context to use to query this node item.
349   *
350   * @return the static context
351   */
352  @NonNull
353  StaticContext getStaticContext();
354
355  @Override
356  default void accept(IItemVisitor visitor) {
357    visitor.visit(this);
358  }
359}
